intro: Oxydectes peraffinis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a daisy. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Oxydectes peraffinis is known for its hardiness and ability to withstand coastal conditions.
